description: Initialize a Spring Boot application and understand auto-configuration.

slides.title: What is Spring Boot? üçÉ
slides.content:
# Opinionated Spring ü§ñ

Spring Framework is powerful but requires lots of XML/Java config.

**Spring Boot** makes it easy to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring based Applications that you can "just run".

No XML configuration required.

slides.title: Spring Initializr
slides.content:
# start.spring.io üöÄ

The easiest way to generate a project.

Select:
- Project: Maven or Gradle
- Language: Java
- Dependencies: Spring Web, Spring Data JPA, etc.

slides.title: The Main Class
Starters
slides.content:
# Dependency Bundles üì¶

Starters are a set of convenient dependency descriptors.

- `spring-boot-starter-web`: Tomcat, Spring MVC.
- `spring-boot-starter-data-jpa`: Hibernate, JDBC.
- `spring-boot-starter-test`: JUnit, Mockito.

slides.title: Embedded Server
slides.content:
# No Tomcat install needed üö´

Spring Boot includes an embedded web server (Tomcat, Jetty, or Undertow).

Just run the JAR file: `java -jar myapp.jar`.

slides.title: Starter Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which starter dependency would you include to build a RESTful web application?

slides.title: application.properties
slides.content:
# Configuration üîß

Centralized configuration file in `src/main/resources`.

`server.port=8081`
`spring.datasource.url=jdbc:mysql://localhost/db`

Also supports YAML (`application.yml`).

slides.title: Auto-configuration
slides.content:
# The Magic ‚ú®

Spring Boot attempts to automatically configure your application based on the jar dependencies.

If `H2` database is on classpath, it automatically configures an in-memory DB connection.

slides.title: DevTools
slides.content:
# Developer Experience üõ†Ô∏è

`spring-boot-devtools` provides:
- Automatic restart when code changes.
- LiveReload.
- Disabled caching for templates during dev.

slides.title: Maven vs Gradle
slides.content:
# Build Tools üèóÔ∏è

- **Maven:** Uses `pom.xml`. XML based. Very stable.
- **Gradle:** Uses `build.gradle`. Groovy/Kotlin based. Faster builds.

slides.title: Component Scanning
slides.content:
# Bean Discovery üîé

Spring looks for classes annotated with `@Component`, `@Service`, `@Repository`, `@Controller` in the sub-packages of the main class.

slides.title: Config Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the default filename for application properties in Spring Boot?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Spring Boot üë¢

Java development simplified.

- **Initializr:** Quick start.
- **Starters:** Easy deps.
- **Auto-Config:** Less boilerplate.
- **Embedded:** Run as JAR.
